sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An historical account, and defence [sic], of the canon of the New Testament In answer to Amyntor. Nye, Stephen, 1648?-1719.
[2], 5-122, [4] p.
printed by J. Darby, for Andrew Bell, at the Cross-Keys and Bible in Cornhil, London : M.DCC. [1700]
Signed Stephen Nye. Amyntor is by John Toland. "An abstract of the foregoing disputation." (p.113) seems to be a summary of Amyntor's arguments. With two final adverisement leaves. Contains running title "A defence of the canon of the New Testament.". Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford.
=======

[2], 5-122, [4] p.
printed by J. Darby, for Andrew Bell, at the Cross-Keys and Bible in Cornhil, London : M.DCC. [1700]
Signed Stephen Nye. Amyntor is by John Toland. "An abstract of the foregoing disputation." (p.113) seems to be a summary of Amyntor's arguments. With two final adverisement leaves. Contains running title "A defence of the canon of the New Testament.". Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford.
Andrew Bell
J. Darby
Cornhil
the Cross-Keys
